about: Our team values the intersection between “Big Data” and software applications. We hope to gain insight into our community through in-depth data analysis and to develop useful software for the Cornell community and beyond.

current.title: Distributed Game Server
current.text: Creating a decentralized distributed system for gaming that uses networked connections to maintain a consensus state across multiple distinct machines.

current.title: Cornell Census
current.text: Aggregating and visualizing data on Cornell students, such as GPA, course preferences, and sentiment from polls.

past.title: Cypria
past.text: An open-source query language that can be interpreted to SQL, making it easier to build complicated queries by using functional constructs that are more intuitive to programmers.

past.title: Twitter Community
past.text: Real-time clustering visualization of Twitter users and their connections with other users.
